data.title: Sacramento Kings to re
data.meta_description: The Sacramento Kings intend to re-sign center Alex Len to a one-year contract once free agency opens on Sunday, per The Athletic.
data.text:
Alex Len is returning for his fifth season in a Sacramento Kings uniform.

According to The Athletic’s Shams Charania, the veteran center intends to ink a one-year deal worth $3.3 million once the NBA free agency period begins at 3:00 PM PDT.

Len, 31, averaged 2.5 points, 2.7 rebounds, and 1.0 assists per game on 61 percent shooting from the field over 9.3 minutes per game (48 appearances) for Sacramento during the 2023-24 season.

The Kings were in need of a backup center as Domantas Sabonis is currently the only other big man on the roster.

With Len now back in the picture, Sacramento general manager Monte McNair will now turn his attention to making upgrades to a Kings roster that has remained largely intact since the beginning of the 2022-23 season.

Sacramento has two open roster spots remaining and is $13 million underneath the first salary tax apron.

More on the Sacramento Kings

Sacramento Kings choose not to extend qualifying offers to 3 players

When is the next NBA off-season date of interest?

Now that the NBA Draft is in the rearview, all eyes will shift to the start of free agency.

All 30 teams will be able to negotiate free-agent deals with players beginning this Sunday, June 30th, at 3:00 PM PDT.

Sacramento already did some heavy lifting by agreeing to a four-year, $78 million deal with Sixth Man of the Year runner-up Malik Monk, as the two sides agreed on a long-term contract last weekend.

Stay locked into Sactown Sports for all of your Kings free agency coverage, including player profiles, trade rumors, and much more.

NBA Offseason Schedule

Sunday, June 30th – Free Agent negotiating window opens (3 PM PST)

Saturday, July 6th – Free Agents can officially sign contracts

July 12-22nd – Las Vegas Summer League

July 27-August 11th – 2024 Olympic Games

Friday, September 27th – NBA training camps begin
